metadata.title: CVE-2021-3621 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in SSSD, where the sssctl command was vulnerable to shellcommand injection via the logs-fetch and cache-expire subcommands. Thisflaw allows an attacker to trick the root user into running a speciallycrafted sssctl command, such as via sudo, to gain root access. The highestthreat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well assystem availability.

criterions.comment: sssd: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
